title: Business & Finance
text:
Disney regained momentum in subscription growth for its Disney+ service and reported record income from its theme parks and resorts.

---

U.S. stocks rose, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow gaining 1.5%, 2.1% and 0.9%, respectively. Government bond yields fell.

---

A California regulatory agency said it has filed a lawsuit against Tesla, alleging racial discrimination and harassment at the company.

---

The Boston Fed selected Susan M. Collins, an economist and administrator at the University of Michigan, to be its next president.

---

The CFTC's chief, at a Senate hearing, called on lawmakers to grant his agency authority to regulate cryptocurrencies such as bitcoin.

---

Japanese auto makers say stress on production is continuing and are striking a more pessimistic tone than their peers in Detroit.

---

Uber's quarterly revenue rose 83%, helped by a recovery in its rides business and continued demand for food delivery.
